Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the preparation of community impact reports for city-subsidized economic development projects
Items.MatterName: Preparation of community impact reports for city-subsidized economic development projects.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to a study on the feasibility of establishing a commercial and residential linkage fee
Items.MatterName: Study on the feasibility of establishing a commercial and residential linkage fee.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the development of a public housing entrepreneurship and commercial popup program
Items.MatterName: NYCHA Package - The development of a public housing entrepreneurship and commercial popup program

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the inclusion of micro-grants in the public housing entrepreneurship and commercial pop up program
Items.MatterName: NYCHA Package - Inclusion of micro-grants in the public housing entrepreneurship and commercial pop up program.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation that would create a linkage fee for large scale residential or commercial projects, and create a trust that would receive this fee to fund job training, education and employment programs.
Items.MatterName: Create a linkage fee for large scale residential or commercial projects, and create a trust that would receive this fee to fund job training, education and employment programs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring certain contracted entities to make public job training and employment data collected pursuant to projects in excess of $150,000.
Items.MatterName: Requiring certain contracted entities to make public job training and employment data collected pursuant to projects in excess of $150,000.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring disclosure of community benefit agreements in the annual report by certain contracted entities.
Items.MatterName: Requiring disclosure of community benefit agreements in the annual report by certain contracted entities.
